short_summary: H2 STOR-age in a suitable geological formation
description: The Department of Natural Resources Canada (NRCan) has a requirement to conduct study into the storage of H2 and the mitigation of risks thereof. Request for information to guide procurement decision
full_summary:
**TCN Notice No:** PW-22-01008911 **Title:** Study on the Storage of H2 in Geologically Suitable Formations **Announcement Date:** 2022-10-03 **Tender Closing Date and Time:** 2022-10-18T16:00:00 **Expedited Information** [Policy ref] **Description** The Natural Resources Canada organization (NRCan) has an interest in undertaking a research project that involves the study of hydrogen (H2) storage and trapping within geologic formations at the pore scale. This research aims to assist policymakers and industry stakeholders in understanding the risks and requirements for storing hydrogen safely across Canada. The proposed procurement will be a collaborative undertaking with the Geological Survey of Canada (GSC) and the Department of Earth Science and Engineering research groups at Imperial College London (ICL). The project entails the following key areas: 1. **Hydrogen Trapping and Interactions**: Exploring the interaction between hydrogen and the geological host formation. 2. **Storage Capacity Estimation**: Assessing the storage capacity of hydrogen based on the type of geological formation and the fluids present. 3. **Buoyancy-Driven Flow and Leakage**: Studying the buoyancy-driven flow and leakage of stored hydrogen. **Contact Information** * **Name**: Nidhi Nigam * **Email**: * **Phone**: 587-337-3877
